SEARCH
Package net.chaossquad.mclib.blocks

Klasse BlockStructure

java.lang.Object
net.chaossquad.mclib.blocks.BlockStructure
public class BlockStructure extends Object
Saves block data in a relative coordinate system for copying and pasting blocks from or to the world.

  • Konstruktorübersicht

    Konstruktoren
    Konstruktor
    Beschreibung
    BlockStructure(int x, int y, int z)
    Creates a new empty block structure with the specified size.
    BlockStructure(BlockBox box)
    Creates a new empty block structure with the size of the specified block box.
    BlockStructure(BlockBox box, org.bukkit.World world)
    Creates a new block structure filled with the contents of the specified BlockBox in the specified world.
    BlockStructure(BlockStructure blockStructure)
    Copies another block structure.
    BlockStructure(org.bukkit.Location a, org.bukkit.util.Vector b)
    Creates a new block structure filled with the contents from the specified location and the size of the specified vector from this location.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • BlockStructure

      public BlockStructure(int x, int y, int z)
      Creates a new empty block structure with the specified size.
      Parameter:
      x - x size
      y - y size
      z - z size

    • BlockStructure

      public BlockStructure(BlockBox box)
      Creates a new empty block structure with the size of the specified block box.
      Parameter:
      box - The BlockBox the size should be used of.

    • BlockStructure

      public BlockStructure(BlockStructure blockStructure)
      Copies another block structure.
      Parameter:
      blockStructure - the other block structure

    • BlockStructure

      public BlockStructure(BlockBox box, org.bukkit.World world)
      Creates a new block structure filled with the contents of the specified BlockBox in the specified world.
      Parameter:
      box - the box the blocks should be copied from
      world - the world the blocks in the block box should be copied from

    • BlockStructure

      public BlockStructure(org.bukkit.Location a, org.bukkit.util.Vector b)
      Creates a new block structure filled with the contents from the specified location and the size of the specified vector from this location.
      Parameter:
      a - Location (world != null)
      b - Size vector

  • Methodendetails

    • clone

      public BlockStructure clone()
      Clones this block structure
      Setzt außer Kraft:
      clone in Klasse Object
      Gibt zurück:
      copy of this block structure

      public int getXLength()
      Returns the x length (width) of the structure.
      Gibt zurück:

      Returns the z length (length)
      Gibt zurück:
      z length (length)

    • toBlockBox

      public BlockBox toBlockBox(int x, int y, int z)
      Returns a BlockBox with the same dimensions as this block structure. The starting point of the block structure can be set with the parameters.
      Parameter:
      x - x shift
      y - y shift
      z - z shift
      Gibt zurück:
      BlockBox with the same dimensions as this block structure.

    • toBlockBox

      public BlockBox toBlockBox(org.bukkit.util.Vector vector)
      Same as
      ungültiges @link 
      {@link this#toBlockBox(int, int, int)
      } with the difference that the vector is used for the shift.
      Parameter:
      vector - shift vector / location vector of starting point
      Gibt zurück:
      BlockBox with the same dimensions as this block structure.

    • getBlocks

      public BlockStructureEntry[][][] getBlocks()
      Creates a full copy of the current block structure's elements and returns it as a 3-dimensional array.
      Gibt zurück:
      3-dimensional array filled with block structure entries.

    • getBlock

      public BlockStructureEntry getBlock(int x, int y, int z)
      Get the block at the specified relative location of the block structure.
      Parameter:
      x - x position
      y - y position
      z - z position
      Gibt zurück:
      block structure entry (not null)

    • getBlock

      public BlockStructureEntry getBlock(org.bukkit.util.Vector location)
      Get the block at the specified relative location of the block structure.
      Parameter:
      location - location vector
      Gibt zurück:
      block structure entry (not null)

    • setBlock

      public void setBlock(int x, int y, int z, BlockStructureEntry entry)
      Set the block at the specified relative location of the block structure.
      Parameter:
      x - x position
      y - y position
      z - z position
      entry - the entry or null to clear

    • setBlock

      public void setBlock(org.bukkit.util.Vector vector, BlockStructureEntry entry)
      Set the block at the specified relative location of the block structure.
      Parameter:
      vector - location vector
      entry - the entry or null to clear

    • paste

      public List<org.bukkit.block.Block> paste(org.bukkit.Location location, int xLevel, int yLevel, int zLevel, List<org.bukkit.Material> ignoreTypes)
      Paste this block structure to a specific location. THE WORLD MUST NOT BE NULL FOR THIS TO WORK!
      Parameter:
      location - location (with world != null)
      xLevel - limits this method to one specific x layer (negative value for all x layers)
      yLevel - limits this method to one specific y layer (negative value for all y layers)
      zLevel - limits this method to one specific z layer (negative value for all z layers)
      ignoreTypes - block types that should be ignored when pasting
      Gibt zurück:
      List of modified blocks

    • paste

      public List<org.bukkit.block.Block> paste(org.bukkit.Location location, int xLevel, int yLevel, int zLevel)
      Paste this block structure to a specific location. THE WORLD MUST NOT BE NULL FOR THIS TO WORK!
      Parameter:
      location - location (with world != null)
      xLevel - limits this method to one specific x layer (negative value for all x layers)
      yLevel - limits this method to one specific y layer (negative value for all y layers)
      zLevel - limits this method to one specific z layer (negative value for all z layers)
      Gibt zurück:
      List of modified blocks

    • paste

      public List<org.bukkit.block.Block> paste(org.bukkit.Location location)
      Paste this block structure to a specific location. THE WORLD MUST NOT BE NULL FOR THIS TO WORK!
      Parameter:
      location - location (with world != null)
      Gibt zurück:
      List of modified blocks

    • hasEnoughSpace

      public boolean hasEnoughSpace(org.bukkit.Location location, int xLevel, int yLevel, int zLevel, List<org.bukkit.Material> ignoreStructureTypes, List<org.bukkit.Material> ignoreWorldTypes)
      Checks if there is enough space to place this structure. THE WORLD MUST NOT BE NULL FOR THIS TO WORK!
      Parameter:
      location - location (with world != null)
      xLevel - limits this method to one specific x layer (negative value for all x layers)
      yLevel - limits this method to one specific y layer (negative value for all y layers)
      zLevel - limits this method to one specific z layer (negative value for all z layers)
      ignoreStructureTypes - blocks in the structure that should be ignored when checking for space (nothing is ignored when list null)
      ignoreWorldTypes - blocks in the world that should be ignored when checking for space (air is ignored when list is null)
      Gibt zurück:
      true when space is free, false when space is not free

    • hasEnoughSpace

      public boolean hasEnoughSpace(org.bukkit.Location location, int xLevel, int yLevel, int zLevel)
      Checks if there is enough space to place this structure. THE WORLD MUST NOT BE NULL FOR THIS TO WORK!
      Parameter:
      location - location (with world != null)
      xLevel - limits this method to one specific x layer (negative value for all x layers)
      yLevel - limits this method to one specific y layer (negative value for all y layers)
      zLevel - limits this method to one specific z layer (negative value for all z layers)
      Gibt zurück:
      true when space is free, false when space is not free

    • hasEnoughSpace

      public boolean hasEnoughSpace(org.bukkit.Location location, List<org.bukkit.Material> ignoreStructureTypes, List<org.bukkit.Material> ignoreWorldTypes)
      Checks if there is enough space to place this structure. THE WORLD MUST NOT BE NULL FOR THIS TO WORK!
      Parameter:
      location - location (with world != null)
      ignoreStructureTypes - blocks in the structure that should be ignored when checking for space (nothing is ignored when list null)
      ignoreWorldTypes - blocks in the world that should be ignored when checking for space (air is ignored when list is null)
      Gibt zurück:
      true when space is free, false when space is not free

    • hasEnoughSpace

      public boolean hasEnoughSpace(org.bukkit.Location location)
      Checks if there is enough space to place this structure. THE WORLD MUST NOT BE NULL FOR THIS TO WORK!
      Parameter:
      location - location (with world != null)
      Gibt zurück:
      true when space is free, false when space is not free

    • copy

      public void copy(org.bukkit.Location location)
      Copy blocks into this block structure. It copies all blocks from the specified location to the location + the structure size.
      Parameter:
      location - starting point (end point is start point + size)

    • transposeXZ

      public void transposeXZ()
      Transposes the X x Z matrix (swaps all x values with all z values and all z values with all x values).

    • rotate90DegRight

      public void rotate90DegRight()
      Rotates the block structure 90 degrees right.

    • rotate90DegLeft

      public void rotate90DegLeft()
      Rotate the block structure 90 degrees left.

    • rotate180Deg

      public void rotate180Deg()
      Rotates the block structure 180 degrees.
